article.text: Bodies of Syrians being made ready for a mass funeral in Houla, Syria. Photo: EPA On the night from Friday to Saturday Houla came under heavy fire attacks. The opposition accuses the government troops, while Syrian authorities deny any involvement. The UN Security Council convenes an emergency session Sunday in connection with the tragic events. Previously, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Gennady Gatilov reported in his Twitter microblog that "there is information that the nature of the wounds received by many of the dead is not consistent with a fire attack." Russia's Deputy FM: tragic events in Houla require detailed scrutiny The tragic events in the Syrian village of Houla in the vicinity of Homs require careful investigation. Such an opinion was expressed by Deputy Foreign Minister of Russia Gennady Gatilov. "The tragic events in Syria, and the death of dozens of people should doubtlessly be condemned. However, we must seriously look into the causes of the incident. There are reports that the nature of the wounds received by many there rule out artillery fire as the cause of death," - wrote the diplomat in his Twitter microblog. On the night from Friday to Saturday Houla came under heavy shelling. The opposition accuses government troops, while Syrian authorities deny any involvement. UNSC to look into Houla tragedy The UN Security Council is convening an emergency session to discuss the killing of at least 116 people, including 34 children, in in the Syrian town of Houla. UN head Ban Ki-moon and his Syria envoy Kofi Annan have strongly denounced this massacre. Head of the UN observer mission in Syria Norwegian General Robert Mood has described it as a 'terrible tragedy'. He also said that reports from his staff have confirmed the Houla deaths. The Syrian authorities have blamed the slaughter on armed rebels. They have also mounted a probe, which is expected to come up with conclusions within three days.
